intro: Reseda bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Reseda bungei is often found in grasslands and along the edges of deserts.
